definition: to go through/to know well/(suffix) expert/to connect/to communicate/open/to clear/classifier for letters, telegrams, phone calls etc
classifier for an activity, taken in its entirety (tirade of abuse, stint of music playing, bout of drinking etc)
tight/strict/close at hand/near/urgent/tense/hard up/short of money/to tighten
to withdraw/to pull back/to contract/to shrink/to reduce/abbreviation/also pr. [su4]

sentences.english: Deflation can be long-lasting and have a chilling effect on stock markets.
sentences.chinese: 通货紧缩可能会持续很长时间，给股市浇上一盆冷水。

sentences.english: THE bubble that caused a global recession has been a long time deflating.
sentences.chinese: 引发全球经济衰退的泡沫就是长期的通货紧缩。

sentences.english: That would make a gold standard practicable and not too deflationary.
sentences.chinese: 这样就会使金币标准可操作了因为不会引起通货紧缩。

sentences.english: HRN: Some people believe a contraction of M3 indicates deflation.
sentences.chinese: 有些人认为，货币供应M3的收缩表明通货紧缩。

sentences.english: Whether China is able to escape the shadow of deflation by the end of the year is still of much concern to those in the economic circle.
sentences.chinese: 经济界人士仍担心年底前能否走出通货紧缩的阴影。

sentences.english: This has leadvert to price competition- resulting in price defl in some ranges.
sentences.chinese: 这招致了价钱竞争，并在一些领域内造成了通货紧缩。

sentences.english: No one thinks that deflation in itself is desirable.
sentences.chinese: 没人认为通货紧缩本身是可取的。

sentences.english: This is a monumentally ill-considered policy in a region that faces deflation.
sentences.chinese: 在通货紧缩的地区，这是非常错误的政策。

sentences.english: "We have been so used to deflation for years and years," said David Bassuk, managing director in the retail practice of AlixPartners.
sentences.chinese: 这么多年来，我们都已经习惯了通货紧缩了。

sentences.english: And both the United States and Europe are well on their way toward Japan-style deflationary traps.
sentences.chinese: 同时，美国和欧洲正在朝日式的通货紧缩陷阱走去。

sentences.english: First we have the deflation shock of lives.
sentences.chinese: 首先，我们将终生承受通货紧缩的打击。

sentences.english: Grant spoke on Bloomberg TelevisonTelevision. The Federal Reserve is tend intent on stimulating economic activity and combatting combating incipient deflation.
sentences.chinese: 美联储打算刺激经济发展并控制起初的通货紧缩。

sentences.english: How exactly are these rentiers benefiting from deflation?
sentences.chinese: 究竟那些收息者怎样从通货紧缩中获利？

sentences.english: This suggests that disinflation is proceeding rapidly.
sentences.chinese: 这说明通货紧缩在快速进行着。

sentences.english: SHOULD you fret more about inflation or deflation?
sentences.chinese: 你更担心通货膨胀还是通货紧缩？

pinyin: e4 xing4 tong1 huo4 peng2 zhang4

definition: local currency/our own currency/abbr. for 本位貨幣|本位货币
